page.title: 13Roadside landscape,2,Rutland
page.content: A walk along Glaston Road in early October 1985 revealed features not apparent on a map. Three tracks lead north from the road; one is unsignposted but perhaps leads tp Launde Farm, the second leads to Welland Vale Nursery, which has a large new greenhouse near the road, and the last has a small rough sign to 'Millhouse and cottages'. There is an interesting hedge on the north side of the road, near the by_pass junction. This contains ash, field maple, elder, sycamore, elm, black bryony, woody nightshade, bindweed and bramble. The elm is interesting as the author of the{Flora {of Rutland,}Guy Messenger, has recently written to{The Times} suggesting that regularly cut elm may be resistant to Dutch Elm Disease.
